Description: Terracotta mould-made protome-bust of a woman. Left forearm fragment, with hand concealing breast. White coating with traces of red paint preserved on some areas of the clothes. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

East Greek protome bust (also known as a ‘shoulder-bust’) of early Classical Greek date (broadly 500BC to 425BC). The fabric is similar to that of figurines of an East Greek origin. Very similar, but different mould series, fragments from at least two protomes that were found at Naukratis (Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA350 joins NA355; NA354 joins NA353; NA390 joins NA850, NA426, NA802, NA803 and NA509) and parallels from Lindos, Rhodes, dated 525BC to 400BC (Blinkenberg 1931, 591, pl.120, no.2525, Type B2, same mould as above Naukratis examples, no.2535, from a different mould is closer to this piece) and in the British Museum from Rhodes, dated mid 5th century BC (Higgins 1954, no. 238, GR1885, 1213.41, same mould as above Naukratis examples). Similar pieces, not from the same mould, were found at Olynthus dated to the early and late 5th century BC (Robinson 1952, pl.12, no.19; pl. 36, no.83; pl.38, nos 98 and 100). For context, function and details on protome parallels and fragments from Naukratis see protome records from Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA350, NA355, NA354, NA353, NA390, NA850, NA426, NA803 and NA509). Blinkenberg, C. 1931. Lindos. Fouilles de l’Acropole 1902-1914, I. Les petits objets, Berlin. Robinson, D. M. 1952. Olynthus XIV. Terracottas, lamps, and coins found in 1934 and 1938. Johns Hopkins University studies in archaeology. Baltimore, Johns Hopkins Press; London, Oxford University Press.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.085) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 83, nos 65, 68-70)
